definition[0]: to or at any place, position, or situation
example[0]: Children will play wherever they happen to be.
example[2]: Dublin people dress more individually than people in London or wherever.
example[3]: She is shadowed by detectives wherever she goes.
example[4]: I feel I ought to be nice to them wherever possible  (=at all times when it is possible).
definition[2]: used at the beginning of a question to show surprise
example[5]: ‘Wherever did she find that?’ Daisy wondered.
